Authors: Lei, Philip I.S. and Mendes, António José
Title: A systematic literature review on knowledge tracing in learning programming
Data Elements: behavior data; demographic data; academic performance; knowledge
Data Category: (learning) behaviour data; interaction data; demographic & biographic data;  resource / assessment data;
Data Parent: (learning) output data; (social) interaction data; master data; cognitive characteristics;
Modeling Approaches:
- „Common models employed in the literature include probabilistic, statistical and artificial neural network models.“
- „[17], the authors formalized the knowledge model as a Fuzzy Cognitive Map of KCs, and defined fuzzy logic rules to update the knowledge levels in the student model“
- „Bayesian Knowledge Tracing (BKT)“
    => „using a Hidden Markov Model (HMM)“
    
- „Dynamic Bayesian Network (DBN)“
    
- „Additive Factor Model (AFM)“
    
- „stereotypes using demographics“
    
- „extension of AFM called Performance Factor Analysis [31]“
    
- „Deep Knowledge Tracing (DKT)“
    => „By treating knowledge tracing as a sequence prediction problem, Piech et al. [32] proposed Deep Knowledge Tracing and its two formulations (exercise-indexed and skill-indexed). Skill-indexed DKT employs Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) recurrent neural networks [33] to predict whether a student can answer an exercise correctly based on the input sequence of the KCs covered and the correctness of answers in previous attempted exercises. As such, DKT builds a single model for all KCs, whereas BKT builds separate model for each KC.“
